title.narrative: Professionalising the Departmental Association of Poultry Farmers of Tarija (ADAT)

description.narrative: ADAT (Departmental Association of Poultry Farmers of Tarija) was founded in 2010 and affiliates 54 poultry farmers that produce poultry for meat and eggs. ADAT is a farmers organisation with growth and economic potential, but needs to professionalise to be able to achieve this potential. The management of ADAT lacks knowledge on how to run a well performing farmers organisation.The financial management of the organisation is precarious: not all revenues and expenditures are accounted for, which means the management does not have full insight into the financial situation. To improve this situation, the board of directors, supervisory board and staff need to be trained in financial management.At the moment, ADAT does not have a long term strategic plan and therefore cannot organise their efforts and resources effectively. Having a long term strategic plan that is made through a participatory process, will give ADAT a basis for developing their services and make them sustainable and for developing lobby and advocacy activities for the members.One of the services that could have potential for ADAT’s members, is a grain storage to provide poultry feed to the members. A feasibility study is needed to determine if there is a business model in this service.
